channel.title: JEditorPanes [PLEASE HELP ME WITH HyperlinkListener]

item.title: JEditorPanes [PLEASE HELP ME WITH HyperlinkListener]
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“new Nub();, post:7, topic:167799”]Method Summary
void hyperlinkUpdate(HyperlinkEvent e)
Called when a hypertext link is updated.

thats all thats in the API[/quote]
check whether or not e.EventType equals e.EventType.ENTERED, EXITED, or ACTIVATED (remember, use .equals(Object otherObject) when comparing two objects (== is for primitive types)

Have fun.

EDIT: Also, another hint, USE FUCKING GOOGLE. Here’s the first non-javadoc result for “HyperLinkListener”:

http://www.devdaily.com/blog/post/jfc-swing/add-hyperlinklistener-java-component/

!!!
!!!
!!!

Read full topic

item.title: JEditorPanes [PLEASE HELP ME WITH HyperlinkListener]
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

you need to do e.getType() or something, it gives an enum type
theres 3 types, one when the mouse moving into the hyperlink, one when it exits, and one when it clicks

you should only change the url when it clicks

Read full topic

item.title: JEditorPanes [PLEASE HELP ME WITH HyperlinkListener]
item.dc:creator: @new_Nub new Nub();
item.description:
@new_Nub wrote:

yeah i noticed. i cant seem to get the hyperlinklistener working…

I got everything I need (I think)…

[code]
public class Main extends JFrame implements HyperlinkListener
{

...

	jEP.addHyperlinkListener(this);

...

public void hyperlinkUpdate(HyperlinkEvent e)
{
	try
	{
		jEP.setPage(e.getURL());
	}
	catch(Throwable t)
	{
		t.printStackTrace();
	}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: JEditorPanes [PLEASE HELP ME WITH HyperlinkListener]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Make it check if the mouse is in the area of the hyper link (build a method to parse the script for hyper links and then return their location) and make it reload the page according to the link. It probably wouldn’t be all that difficult to do.

Read full topic

item.title: JEditorPanes [PLEASE HELP ME WITH HyperlinkListener]
item.dc:creator: @new_Nub new Nub();
item.description:
@new_Nub wrote:

See my last post and tell me what I’m doing wrong.

I ran a Demo from from sun.com and ran it. It had a JEditor Pane on it. It said inside it it could load the html from a specified URL.
I went to the API and checked it out. And it works its quite neat.

1 Problem… Most script doesnt work nor do hyper links so its not really ment for browsing

Heres a simple JFrame which only consists of a JEditorPane for those who are too lazy to check it out.

[code]import javax.swing.*;

public class Main extends JFrame
{
static JEditorPane jEP;
static Main a;

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	a = new Main();
}
public Main()
{
	super("JEditorPane Test.");
	
	try
	{
		jEP = new JEditorPane("http://www.google.com");
	}
	catch(Exception e)
	{
		System.out.println("ERROR");
	}
	
	add(new JScrollPane(jEP));
	
	setDefaultCloseOperation(3);
	pack();
	setVisible(true);
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
